page.title: 14A FARM IN THIS AREA.
page.content: SPALSBURY FARM WAS BUILT IN THE LATE 15th CENTURY.IT IS WHAT IS KNOWN AS A DEVON LONG HOUSE. IT IS A LISTED BUILDING SCHEDULE 11.IT HAS 16 ROOMS AND IS BUILT OF COB AND STONE. IT USED TO HAVE A THATCHED ROOF BUT NOW HAS A RED TILE ROOF. ONE END OF THE HOUSE WAS ONLY BUILT ON ABOUT 100 YEARS AGO.EVEN NOW THERE IS NO SOLID INTERNAL WALL DIVISIONS. IN THE DINING ROOM THERE WERE SOME BREAD OVENS WHICH YOU CAN STILL SEE. IN THE 19th CENTURY A SECOND FRONT DOOR WAS ADDED TO MAKE EASIER WORKING FROM THE FARMYARD.TWO OF THE FARMYARD BUILDINGS WERE BUILT AT THE SAME TIME OF THE HOUSE.MR. AND MRS. PIDSLEY HAVE LIVED THERE FOR ABOUT 20 YEARS.ALL OF THEOTHER FAMILIES THAT HAVE LIVED THEREHAD QUITE LARGE FAMILIES.
